content.body:
annevk: I don't hate maintainers because I'm a maintainer myself
I know how hard it is to maintain, but I was amazed when I saw some questions on the MDN forums that were not answered a year ago

content.body:
> <@alex.hsu:matrix.org> annevk: I don't hate maintainers because I'm a maintainer myself
> I know how hard it is to maintain, but I was amazed when I saw some questions on the MDN forums that were not answered a year ago

If by "MDN forums", you mean https://discourse.mozilla.org, then I'm not sure how many of the maintainers actually read that. I definitely don't. But I do read (and often triage) every single issue posted to https://github.com/mdn/content/issues minutes or at most a few hours after they are posted. So I'd personally recommend you ignore the Discourse instance and just post to that GitHub issue tracker instead

content.body: Ah, well with BCD issues you're likely to get a response more quickly if you just go ahead and raise a PR with a patch for the relevant JSON data file
In this case your patch would add a note to the Android Chrome browser compat data for type=time input element

> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> Ah, well with BCD issues you're likely to get a response more quickly if you just go ahead and raise a PR with a patch for the relevant JSON data file

I'm using the official way, without any JS effects
HTML only

content.body:
> <@alex.hsu:matrix.org> I'm using the official way, without any JS effects
> HTML only

I meant that you'd want to add a text note saying something like "Android 11 doesn't show AM or PM"Â in the file at https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/blob/main/html/elements/input/time.json#L14
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @alex.hsu:matrix.org
I'm using the official way, without any JS effects
HTML only

> <@sideshowbarker:mozilla.org> I meant that you'd want to add a text note saying something like "Android 11 doesn't show AM or PM"Â in the file at https://github.com/mdn/browser-compat-data/blob/main/html/elements/input/time.json#L14

 * I follow this.To put it simply, I add an input type='time' to my html, which should be displayed on android in the same way as the official document.
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input/time

content.body: annevk: not sure what the latest is on ORB/CORB but it looks like a WebKit contributor wants to implement CORB per the current Fetch spec: https://lists.webkit.org/pipermail/webkit-dev/2022-March/032161.html . Might be worth chiming in with the status.
content.formatted_body: annevk: not sure what the latest is on ORB/CORB but it looks like a WebKit contributor wants to implement CORB per the current Fetch spec: https://lists.webkit.org/pipermail/webkit-dev/2022-March/032161.html . Might be worth chiming in with the status.
